channel.title: Check my work please - Algebra 2
channel.description:
Hey guys, I know this is a super easy problem but I have finals tomorrow. We get a notecard to write information on for the test and I need to make sure this is right. This is really easy but I need to be extra sure the information on my notecard is not wrong.
Simplify and write in standard form (2x-3)(4x^2-7x+5) Distribute 2x-3: 8x^3-26x^2+21x-15
I think that is right but I am not sure if there is some way to factor it out. Thanks in advance!

item.title: Check my work please - Algebra 2
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

1. Basic formula written out
(2x-3)(4x[sup]2[/sup]-7x+5)

2. The first distributed into the second.
First part
Second part
((2x * 4x[sup]2[/sup]) - (2x * 7x) + (2x * 5)) - ((3*4x[sup]2[/sup] *4x) - (3 * 7x) + (3 * 5))

2.1 The first part of the second step simplified.
(8x[sup]3[/sup]) - (14x[sup]2[/sup]) + (10x)

2.2 The second part of the second step simplified.
-(12x[sup]2[/sup]) - (21x) + (15)

3. The two simplified parts put together
(8x[sup]3[/sup] - 14x[sup]2[/sup] + 10x) - (12x[sup]2[/sup] - 21x + 15)

4. Change all of the second part to negative to make things less confusing.
Changed part (All signs including one in front changed to be the opposite sign)
(8x[sup]3[/sup] - 14x[sup]2[/sup] + 10x) + (-12x[sup]2[/sup] + 21x - 15)

5. Combine like terms
8x[sup]3[/sup] - 26x[sup]2[/sup] + 31x - 15

If you donâ€™t know if you made any mistakes, there are many online tools. I used this one to check.

Read full topic
